etymology.description: 天(天) (tiān, "heaven; sky"), 氣(氣) (qì, "air; atmosphere"), 預(預) (yù, "in advance; beforehand"), 報(報) (bào, "report; announce")
etymology.interpretation: The word 天氣預報 (tiānqì yùbào) combines the elements of the sky and atmosphere (天氣/天氣) with the concept of reporting or announcing in advance (預報/預報), which effectively communicates the idea of predicting and announcing the weather conditions ahead of time.

examples.chinese: 我每天早上看天气预报(我每天早上看天氣預報)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ měitiān zǎoshang kàn tiānqì yùbào.
examples.english: I check the weather forecast every morning.

examples.chinese: 电视上报道天气预报(電視上報道天氣預報)，预示着大风天气(預示著大風天氣)。
examples.pinyin: Diànshì shàng bàodào tiānqì yùbào, yùshìzhe dàfēng tiānqì.
examples.english: The TV broadcasts the weather forecast, indicating strong winds.
